Sentencas: The function of systems and devices in many technologically important applications depends on dynamic processes in complex environments not accessible by structure and property characterization tools.
Titulo: Direct In Situ Probe of Electrochemical Processes in Operating Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Fuel cells represent an example in which interactions occur under extreme conditions: high pressure, high temperature, in reactive gas environments.
Titulo: Direct In Situ Probe of Electrochemical Processes in Operating Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here, scanning surface potential microscopy is used to quantify local potential at electrode/electrolyte interfaces in operating solid oxide fuel cells at 600 degrees C. Two types of fuel cells are compared to demonstrate two mechanisms of ionic transport at interfaces.
Titulo: Direct In Situ Probe of Electrochemical Processes in Operating Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Lanthanum strontium ferrite yttria-stabilized zirconia (LSF-YSZ) and lanthanum strontium manganite-yttria-stabilized zirconia (LSM-YSZ) cross-sectional electrode assemblies were measured to compare mixed ionic electronic conducting and electronic conducting mechanisms.
Titulo: Direct In Situ Probe of Electrochemical Processes in Operating Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Direct observation of the active zones in these devices yields characteristic length scales and estimates of activation barrier changes.
Titulo: Direct In Situ Probe of Electrochemical Processes in Operating Fuel Cells
